governing_standards: ESRS 1 - General Requirements (cross-cutting architecture, materiality, presentation rules)
ESRS 2 - General Disclosures (governance, strategy, risk management, metrics baseline)
csrd_reporting_requirements.timeframe_covered: Full financial year (must align exactly with financial reporting period)
csrd_reporting_requirements.lookback_base_year: Minimum 1 prior year for comparative information; 3+ years recommended for trend visibility
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: High — numeric KPIs, narrative context, policies, targets, risk descriptions, forward-looking statements
areas: All material ESG topics identified via Double Materiality Assessment
EU Taxonomy disclosures (eligibility, alignment, turnover/capex/opex KPIs)
Environmental topics (ESRS E1-E5)
Social topics (ESRS S1-S4)
Governance topics (ESRS G1)
key_disclosures: GOV-1: Board composition and oversight of sustainability
GOV-2: Management roles and responsibilities
GOV-3: Integration of sustainability performance in remuneration
GOV-4: Statement on due diligence
GOV-5: Risk and opportunity management
SBM-1: Strategy, business model and value chain
SBM-2: Stakeholder engagement
SBM-3: Material impacts, risks and opportunities
IRO-1: Identification and assessment of impacts, risks and opportunities
IRO-2: Disclosure requirements covered and data points
csrd_reporting_requirements.format_requirements: Published within the Management Report; tagged in XHTML/iXBRL for machine readability per ESRS Taxonomy
csrd_reporting_requirements.assurance: Limited assurance required from first year; transitioning to reasonable assurance (timeline TBD by EU)

phased_application.wave_1: FY2024 — Large PIEs with >500 employees (report in 2025)
phased_application.wave_2: FY2025 — All other large companies (report in 2026)
phased_application.wave_3: FY2026 — Listed SMEs (report in 2027, with opt-out to 2028)

governing_standards: ESRS 1 - General Requirements (Section 3: Double Materiality)
ESRS 2 - IRO-1: Description of processes to identify and assess material IROs
csrd_reporting_requirements.frequency: Annual (reviewed and updated each reporting cycle)
csrd_reporting_requirements.timeframe_covered: Current and historical data used for analysis; forward-looking horizon of 1, 3, 5 and 10+ years
csrd_reporting_requirements.lookback_base_year: Historical data where relevant to justify materiality decisions; no fixed minimum
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Analytical — for each ESG topic, evidence of impact magnitude, likelihood, scope, irremediability (impact materiality) and financial effect size and probability (financial materiality)
areas: Impact materiality — company effects on environment and society (actual and potential, positive and negative)
Financial materiality — ESG risks and opportunities affecting company financial performance, position or cash flows
topics_assessed: ESRS E3 - Water and Marine Resources
ESRS E5 - Resource Use and Circular Economy
ESRS S2 - Workers in the Value Chain
process_requirements: Stakeholder engagement to inform impact identification
Documentation of scoring methodology for impact and financial materiality
Validation by senior management and board
Clear rationale for topics assessed as not material (with disclosure of omissions per ESRS 1)
csrd_reporting_requirements.notes: Determines which ESRS disclosure requirements are included in the Sustainability Report. Non-material topics must still be documented with justification.

governing_standards: ESRS E1 - Climate Change
csrd_reporting_requirements.timeframe_covered: Full financial year; forward-looking targets to 2030, 2040, 2050
csrd_reporting_requirements.lookback_base_year: Base year for GHG inventory (typically 2019 or earliest available); prior year for comparison
key_disclosures: E1-1: Transition plan for climate change mitigation
E1-2: Policies related to climate change mitigation and adaptation
E1-3: Actions and resources for climate change mitigation and adaptation
E1-4: Targets related to climate change mitigation and adaptation
E1-5: Energy consumption and mix (MWh, % renewables, intensity)
E1-6: Gross Scope 1, 2, 3 GHG emissions (tCO2e, with methodology)
E1-7: GHG removals and carbon credits (if applicable)
E1-8: Internal carbon pricing
E1-9: Anticipated financial effects of climate-related physical and transition risks

governing_standards: ESRS E2 - Pollution
key_disclosures: E2-1: Policies related to pollution
E2-2: Actions and resources related to pollution
E2-3: Targets related to pollution
E2-4: Pollution of air, water, and soil (pollutant types, quantities, units)
E2-5: Substances of concern and substances of very high concern (SVHC)
E2-6: Anticipated financial effects of pollution-related risks and opportunities

csrd_reporting_requirements.document_type: ESRS E3 - Water and Marine Resources Disclosure
governing_standards: ESRS E3 - Water and Marine Resources
key_disclosures: E3-1: Policies related to water and marine resources
E3-2: Actions and resources related to water and marine resources
E3-3: Targets related to water and marine resources
E3-4: Water consumption (m³ total, in water-stressed areas, intensity)
E3-5: Anticipated financial effects of water and marine resource risks

csrd_reporting_requirements.document_type: ESRS E4 - Biodiversity and Ecosystems Disclosure
governing_standards: ESRS E4 - Biodiversity and Ecosystems
csrd_reporting_requirements.lookback_base_year: Prior year; historical baseline for ecosystem assessments where available
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: High quantitative and qualitative; site-level data for sensitive areas
key_disclosures: E4-1: Transition plan and consideration of biodiversity and ecosystems in strategy
E4-2: Policies related to biodiversity and ecosystems
E4-3: Actions and resources related to biodiversity and ecosystems
E4-4: Targets related to biodiversity and ecosystems
E4-5: Impact metrics (land use, land use change, species affected)
E4-6: Anticipated financial effects of biodiversity and ecosystem risks

csrd_reporting_requirements.document_type: ESRS E5 - Resource Use and Circular Economy Disclosure
governing_standards: ESRS E5 - Resource Use and Circular Economy
key_disclosures: E5-1: Policies related to resource use and circular economy
E5-2: Actions and resources related to resource use and circular economy
E5-3: Targets related to resource use and circular economy
E5-4: Resource inflows (materials, virgin vs. recycled, weight in tonnes)
E5-5: Resource outflows (waste, by type and disposal method, tonnes)
E5-6: Anticipated financial effects of resource use and circular economy risks

governing_standards: ESRS S1 - Own Workforce
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: High quantitative (headcount, rates, pay) and qualitative (policies, grievance mechanisms)
key_disclosures: S1-1: Policies related to own workforce
S1-2: Processes for engaging with own workers and workers' representatives
S1-3: Processes to remediate negative impacts and channels to raise concerns
S1-4: Action plans and resources on material impacts on own workforce
S1-5: Targets related to managing material negative impacts, risks and opportunities
S1-6: Characteristics of the undertaking's employees (headcount by gender, country, employment type)
S1-7: Characteristics of non-employee workers
S1-8: Collective bargaining coverage and social dialogue
S1-9: Diversity metrics (gender by management level, age distribution)
S1-10: Adequate wages (living wage benchmark compliance)
S1-11: Social protection coverage
S1-12: Persons with disabilities
S1-13: Training and skills development metrics (hours, % covered)
S1-14: Health and safety metrics (TRIR, lost-time injury rate, fatalities, work-related ill health)
S1-15: Work-life balance metrics (parental leave take-up)
S1-16: Compensation metrics (CEO pay ratio, gender pay gap)
alignment: UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights

csrd_reporting_requirements.document_type: ESRS S2 - Workers in the Value Chain Disclosure
governing_standards: ESRS S2 - Workers in the Value Chain
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Qualitative (policies, due diligence) and quantitative where available (audit findings, remediation cases)
key_disclosures: S2-1: Policies related to value chain workers
S2-2: Processes for engaging with value chain workers
S2-3: Processes to remediate negative impacts and channels to raise concerns
S2-4: Action plans and resources on material impacts on value chain workers
S2-5: Targets related to managing material impacts on value chain workers
alignment: UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights
EU Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CS3D)

governing_standards: ESRS S3 - Affected Communities
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Qualitative (engagement, grievance processes) and quantitative where available
key_disclosures: S3-1: Policies related to affected communities
S3-2: Processes for engaging with affected communities
S3-3: Processes to remediate negative impacts and channels to raise concerns
S3-4: Action plans and resources on material impacts on affected communities
S3-5: Targets related to managing material impacts on affected communities
alignment: UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP)
UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights

csrd_reporting_requirements.document_type: ESRS S4 - Consumers and End-users Disclosure
governing_standards: ESRS S4 - Consumers and End-users
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Qualitative (policies, complaints handling) and quantitative (incidents, recall data)
key_disclosures: S4-1: Policies related to consumers and end-users
S4-2: Processes for engaging with consumers and end-users
S4-3: Processes to remediate negative impacts and channels to raise concerns
S4-4: Action plans and resources on material impacts on consumers and end-users
S4-5: Targets related to managing material impacts on consumers and end-users

governing_standards: ESRS G1 - Business Conduct
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Qualitative (policies, whistleblowing framework) and quantitative (confirmed incidents, fines)
key_disclosures: G1-1: Corporate culture and business conduct policies (code of conduct, anti-corruption, anti-bribery)
G1-2: Management of relationships with suppliers
G1-3: Prevention and detection of corruption and bribery (training %, incidents investigated)
G1-4: Incidents of corruption and bribery (confirmed cases, sanctions, criminal proceedings)
G1-5: Political influence and lobbying activities
G1-6: Payment practices (average payment period vs. contractual terms, SME late payment data)

governing_standards: EU Taxonomy Regulation (2020/852)
Delegated Acts for Climate Change Mitigation and Adaptation (2021)
Delegated Acts for remaining four objectives (2023)
ESRS 2 - Appendix B: Mandatory EU Taxonomy disclosures
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: High quantitative — KPIs expressed as % of turnover, capex, opex that are taxonomy-eligible and taxonomy-aligned
six_environmental_objectives: 3. Sustainable Use and Protection of Water and Marine Resources
6. Protection and Restoration of Biodiversity and Ecosystems
csrd_reporting_requirements.dnsh_criteria: Do No Significant Harm (DNSH) criteria must be met for all six objectives for an activity to be taxonomy-aligned
csrd_reporting_requirements.minimum_safeguards: Compliance with OECD Guidelines for MNEs and UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights required
key_disclosures: Proportion of taxonomy-eligible vs. non-eligible economic activities
Proportion of taxonomy-aligned activities (subset of eligible)
Turnover KPI: % of revenue from aligned activities
CapEx KPI: % of capital expenditure associated with aligned activities
OpEx KPI: % of operational expenditure associated with aligned activities

governing_standards: ESRS 1 - General Requirements (Section 4-5: Strategy, Governance, Materiality integration)
ESRS 2 - GOV-1 to GOV-5, SBM-1 to SBM-3, IRO-1 to IRO-2
csrd_reporting_requirements.timeframe_covered: Current year and forward-looking (short: <1 yr, medium: 1-5 yrs, long: >5 yrs)
csrd_reporting_requirements.lookback_base_year: Context against prior year; multi-year strategic cycle where relevant
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Qualitative — detailed descriptions of strategy, governance roles, risk management processes, stakeholder engagement
areas: Integration of sustainability in overall business strategy and business model
Board and senior management oversight of sustainability (committee structures, frequency of review)
Risk and opportunity identification, assessment, and management processes for all material ESG topics
Linkage between sustainability targets and financial planning
Stakeholder engagement approach and outcomes informing strategy

governing_standards: ESRS 1 - General Requirements (Section 9: Assurance)
ISAE 3000 (Revised) - Assurance Engagements Other than Audits or Reviews
ISSA 5000 - International Standard on Sustainability Assurance (forthcoming IAASB standard)
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: High — includes methodology documentation, internal controls evidence, source data traceability, verification evidence
areas: Verification of all reported ESG KPIs (Scope 1/2/3 GHG, energy, water, waste, social metrics)
Internal controls design and operating effectiveness
Calculation methodologies with GHG Protocol, ESRS, and other standard references
Third-party assurance engagement evidence (limited assurance as minimum; reasonable assurance roadmap)
Management representation letters
Audit trails linking reported figures to source systems

assurance_levels.limited_assurance: Required from first year of CSRD application (negative assurance: nothing has come to our attention)
assurance_levels.reasonable_assurance: Future requirement per EU Commission review; provides positive assurance equivalent to financial audit

governing_standards: ESRS 1 - General Requirements (Section 7: Reporting Quality Principles)
Internal data governance requirements to support ESRS disclosures
csrd_reporting_requirements.frequency: Ongoing (monthly or quarterly collection; annual consolidation)
csrd_reporting_requirements.lookback_base_year: Historical data maintained for trend analysis, audit support, and base year recalculation (minimum 3 years recommended)
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Detailed — source systems, measurement methods, conversion factors used, data owner, date of extraction, version control
areas: Energy consumption (electricity, heat, fuel by source — MWh/GJ)
GHG emissions Scope 1 (direct combustion, process, fugitive)
GHG emissions Scope 2 (market-based and location-based)
GHG emissions Scope 3 (all 15 categories; at minimum categories 1 and 11)
Water withdrawal and consumption by source and stress level
Waste generation by type, hazardous classification, and disposal route
HR metrics (headcount, turnover, absenteeism, training hours, pay gap data)
Health and safety metrics (TRIR, fatalities, near misses)
Supplier and value chain ESG data (audit results, corrective actions, screening outcomes)

governing_standards: ESRS 1 - General Requirements (Section 7: Reporting Quality — accuracy, completeness, verifiability)
ISAE 3000 internal control requirements for assurance readiness
csrd_reporting_requirements.frequency: Ongoing (updated as processes change; reviewed annually)
csrd_reporting_requirements.lookback_base_year: Operational records supporting trend analysis; version history of procedural changes
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Procedural — description of internal controls, validation steps, responsible parties, error tracking, correction procedures
areas: Data quality controls (completeness checks, outlier detection, gap estimation methodology)
Calculation verification (formula documentation, unit conversion checks, third-party factor source references)
Scope boundary definitions (consolidation approach: operational control, financial control, or equity share)
Audit trail and version control for all reported data points
Escalation and restatement procedures for prior period corrections

governing_standards: ESRS 1 - General Requirements (Section 6: Comparative Information)
ESRS E1-6 (base year for GHG inventory)
EU Taxonomy Regulation (year-on-year KPI tracking)
csrd_reporting_requirements.frequency: Ongoing — maintained continuously; formally reviewed at each annual reporting cycle
csrd_reporting_requirements.timeframe_covered: All previous reporting years from first year of CSRD application onwards
csrd_reporting_requirements.lookback_base_year: Multiple years to enable trend, target progress, and base year comparisons (3-5 years minimum; 10+ years for GHG base year)
csrd_reporting_requirements.granularity: Quantitative and qualitative historical data with consistent methodology notes to enable like-for-like comparison
areas: All previously reported ESRS E1-E5, S1-S4, G1 KPIs
EU Taxonomy KPIs (turnover, capex, opex) by year
Policy changes, governance updates, and strategy revisions
Materiality decisions from prior years with rationale
Prior DMA outputs and changes in material topic scope
Target trajectories and progress against milestones
csrd_reporting_requirements.restatement_rules: Prior year figures must be restated and clearly flagged when: methodology changes, acquisitions/disposals alter scope, or errors are corrected — per ESRS 1 Section 6
